s0161.literal: He posthumously honored King Zhuangxiang as the Grand Supreme Sovereign.
s0161.idiomatic: He posthumously honored King Zhuangxiang as the Grand Supreme Sovereign.

s0162.chinese: 制曰：「朕聞太古有號毋謚，中古有號，死而以行為謐。
s0162.literal: The decree said: "I have heard that in high antiquity there were titles but no posthumous names; in middle antiquity there were titles, and upon death posthumous names were given based on their conduct.
s0162.idiomatic: The decree said: "I have heard that in high antiquity there were titles but no posthumous names; in middle antiquity there were titles, and upon death posthumous names were given based on their conduct.

s0163.chinese: 如此，則子議父，臣議君也，甚無謂，朕弗取焉。
s0163.literal: If this is so, then sons judge fathers and ministers judge lords, which is utterly meaningless; I will not adopt this.
s0163.idiomatic: If this is so, then sons judge fathers and ministers judge lords, which is utterly meaningless; I will not adopt this.

s0164.literal: From now on, abolish the system of posthumous names.
s0164.idiomatic: From now on, abolish the system of posthumous names.

s0166.chinese: 後世以計數，二世三世至于萬世，傳之無窮。」
s0166.literal: Later generations shall be counted numerically: Second Generation, Third Generation, up to ten thousand generations, transmitted without end."
s0166.idiomatic: Later generations shall be counted numerically: Second Generation, Third Generation, up to ten thousand generations, transmitted without end."

s0168.chinese: 始皇推終始五德之傳，以為周得火德，秦代周德，從所不勝。
s0168.literal: The First Emperor, reasoning through the transmission of the Five Virtues from beginning to end, considered that Zhou possessed the virtue of Fire, and since Qin replaced Zhou's virtue, it followed what it did not conquer.
s0168.idiomatic: The First Emperor, reasoning through the transmission of the Five Virtues from beginning to end, considered that Zhou possessed the virtue of Fire, and since Qin replaced Zhou's virtue, it followed what it did not conquer.

s0169.chinese: 方今水德之始，改年始，朝賀皆自十月朔。
s0169.literal: Now at the beginning of the Water virtue, the year's beginning was changed; court audiences and congratulations all began from the first day of the tenth month.
s0169.idiomatic: Now at the beginning of the Water virtue, the year's beginning was changed; court audiences and congratulations all began from the first day of the tenth month.

s0170.literal: Clothing, banners, tallies, and flags were all black.
s0170.idiomatic: Clothing, banners, tallies, and flags were all black.

s0171.chinese: 數以六為紀，符、法冠皆六寸，而輿六尺，六尺為步，乘六馬。
s0171.literal: Numbers used six as the base: tallies and official caps were all six inches, carriages were six feet, six feet made one pace, and they rode six horses.
s0171.idiomatic: Numbers used six as the base: tallies and official caps were all six inches, carriages were six feet, six feet made one pace, and they rode six horses.

s0172.chinese: 更名河曰德水，以為水德之始。
s0172.literal: The Yellow River was renamed De River, marking the beginning of the Water virtue.
s0172.idiomatic: The Yellow River was renamed De River, marking the beginning of the Water virtue.

s0173.chinese: 剛毅戾深，事皆決於法，刻削毋仁恩和義，然後合五德之數。
s0173.literal: Firm, resolute, stern, and profound, all matters were decided by law, severe and without benevolence, kindness, harmony, or righteousness, only then matching the number of the Five Virtues.
s0173.idiomatic: Firm, resolute, stern, and profound, all matters were decided by law, severe and without benevolence, kindness, harmony, or righteousness, only then matching the number of the Five Virtues.

s0174.literal: Thereupon laws became harsh, and those imprisoned long were not pardoned.
s0174.idiomatic: Thereupon laws became harsh, and those imprisoned long were not pardoned.

s0175.chinese: 丞相綰等言：「諸侯初破，燕、齊、荊地遠，不為置王，毋以填之。
s0175.literal: Prime Minister Wan and others said: "The feudal lords have just been defeated; Yan, Qi, and Jing are distant; if we do not establish kings, there will be no one to pacify them.
s0175.idiomatic: Prime Minister Wan and others said: "The feudal lords have just been defeated; Yan, Qi, and Jing are distant; if we do not establish kings, there will be no one to pacify them.

s0176.literal: We request to install princes; may Your Majesty graciously approve."
s0176.idiomatic: We request to install princes; may Your Majesty graciously approve."

s0177.chinese: 始皇下其議於群臣，群臣皆以為便。
s0177.literal: The First Emperor submitted this proposal to the assembled ministers; all the ministers considered it expedient.
s0177.idiomatic: The First Emperor submitted this proposal to the assembled ministers; all the ministers considered it expedient.

s0178.chinese: 廷尉李斯議曰：「周文武所封子弟同姓甚眾，然後屬疏遠，相攻擊如仇讎，諸侯更相誅伐，周天子弗能禁止。
s0178.literal: Commandant of Justice Li Si argued: "The sons, younger brothers, and clansmen enfeoffed by Kings Wen and Wu of Zhou were very numerous, but later when relations became distant, they attacked each other like enemies; feudal lords mutually attacked and killed each other, and the Son of Heaven of Zhou could not prohibit or stop it.
s0178.idiomatic: Commandant of Justice Li Si argued: "The sons, younger brothers, and clansmen enfeoffed by Kings Wen and Wu of Zhou were very numerous, but later when relations became distant, they attacked each other like enemies; feudal lords mutually attacked and killed each other, and the Son of Heaven of Zhou could not prohibit or stop it.

s0179.chinese: 今海內賴陛下神靈一統，皆為郡縣，諸子功臣以公賦稅重賞賜之，甚足易制。
s0179.literal: Now all within the seas, relying on Your Majesty's divine power, is unified as commanderies and counties; princes and meritorious officials are abundantly rewarded with tax revenues; this is very easy to control.
s0179.idiomatic: Now all within the seas, relying on Your Majesty's divine power, is unified as commanderies and counties; princes and meritorious officials are abundantly rewarded with tax revenues; this is very easy to control.

s0180.chinese: 天下無異意，則安寧之術也。
s0180.literal: When all under Heaven has no divergent intentions, this is the technique of peace and tranquility.
s0180.idiomatic: When all under Heaven has no divergent intentions, this is the technique of peace and tranquility.

s0181.literal: Establishing feudal lords is not expedient."
s0181.idiomatic: Establishing feudal lords is not expedient."
